thread.title: Tottenham USA pre-season tour: Spurs to play Manchester City, PSG and Roma in International Champions Cup
thread.title_full: Tottenham USA pre-season tour: Spurs to play Manchester City, PSG and Roma in International Champions Cup

author: MARCO GIACOMELLI
title: Tottenham USA pre-season tour: Spurs to play Manchester City, PSG and Roma in International Champions Cup
text:
12/12 The aim.... 
Spurs have not lifted a top-flight title since 1961. 
Tottenham are to play pre-season friendlies in the USA against Paris Saint-Germain , Roma and Manchester City . 
The matches, which were being announced today, will make up part of the United States leg of the International Champions Cup . The tournament also includes Arsenal playing Bayern Munich in Shanghai and Chelsea facing Bayern and Inter Milan in Singapore. 
Spurs will play French champions PSG, the former club of manager Mauricio Pochettino, at the Camping World Stadium in Orlando, Florida on July 22 before travelling to Harrison, New Jersey to face Roma at the Red Bull Arena, home of MLS side New York Red Bulls, three days later. 
They finish the tour on July 29 against Premier League rivals City at the Nissan Stadium in Nashville, Tennessee. 
The trip is a chance for Spurs to boost the brand in the USA as the club continue to search for a naming rights partner for their new stadium, which will also host NFL matches. Tottenham's new stadium in numbers 
Tottenham have held discussions with several high-profile companies regarding naming rights, though a deal is unlikely to be agreed until nearing their moving-in date. 
On Thursday, Tottenham will learn whether their aim to play their home matches at Wembley in front of full capacity next season will be approved by Brent council’s planning committee. Spurs undecided whether to hire direct replacement for Paul Mitchell 
The Council officers recommended last week that the committee accepts the proposal. 
Spurs wish to have full use of the national stadium’s 90,000 seats for possibly all their home games, if they move to Wembley next term while construction continues on their new ground. Tottenham say they have until March 31 to inform Wembley whether they will spend 2017-18 there. In Pictures | Inside Tottenham's new stadium In Pictures | Inside Tottenham's new stadium 1/11 The Tunnel Club 
The first purpose-built glass-walled Tunnel Club in the UK which will allow lounge guests to see the inner sanctum with a behind-the-scenes view of the players’ tunnel, while also enjoying the action from player-spec ‘Recaro-style’ seats, located behind the First Team technical area. 2/11 The Tunnel Club Tottenham Hotspur FC 3/11 The Sky Louge 
Situated on level nine of the stadium, the Sky Lounge will offer a relaxed and informal experience surrounded by panoramic views both within and outside the stadium. 4/11 The H Club 
An exceptional Members’ Club, will offer a range of Michelin star calibre dining experiences including the opportunity to dine at the chef’s table or with Club legends on a privately hosted table. 5/11 The H Club 7/11 The H Club 8/11 East Stand premium dining 
The selection of dining experiences is extensive, ranging from street-food grazing to in-suite chefs and Michelin star quality dining. 9/11 The East Lower stand 10/11 Super Loges 
Contemporary Super Loges will feature for the first time in a UK stadium and are therefore expected to be extremely popular as they provide the intimacy of a private dining experience with access to a Members’ lounge bar for networking. 11/11 
Last summer Spurs played in the Australian leg of the ICC, losing both their games in Melbourne. 
A Spurs side, featuring an inexperienced back four, went down 2-1 to Juventus and they were then beaten 1-0 by Atletico Madrid.
